content.description: Sit start and move left to a good, flat crimp and move up and top out.   This is probably easier for taller climbers.
content.location: In the alcove on the left side of the boulder

content.description: Sit start, move right along the lip, and top out over the peak.
content.location: This is on the backside of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start matched on a good diagonal edge. Move right and up the steep wall. The smaller boulder does not give you much room for the foot, and the landing is bad.
content.location: It is in the alcove on the left side of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start and move up the overhang and steep slab to finish on a killer sloper.
content.location: This is on the far right side of the big boulder. Start just left of a small cave.

content.description: Sit start with your left hand on a one finger wide sidepull/bump and your right hand really low on a sloper. Get your feet set, and pull your arse off the pad and move up and match on crimps, then get a right hand pinch and slap to the top and top out.
content.location: This ascends the stunning, overhanging arête on the right side of the boulder.

content.description: These are essentially two big blocks with a few problems. I did these problems years ago and just revisited the place to record it. There is a lot of quartz in this rock, so it can be tough on the fingers. This is not a destination. It is in Wilmington Town Forest.
